column5: Hello all,Looking into a trip next summer for trophy pike. Will be driving from Iowa so somewhere north of Int Falls would be good.Any suggestions are greatly appreciated. Have done a walleye trip out of Atikokan but have not done a trip for Trophy Pike.Thanks in advanceLarry
Give Kelsey a call at Wilderness Air 1-800-760-0924 they run a great operation. Their website is www.great-fishing.com They will take great care of you.
Eddie North.............went this fall & had 3 over 40in myself......for the week in camp 45in was tops. Best big Pike fishing I've seen in over 25 trips.
Eddies for sure, last aug, we had 12 over 40 for just 4 guys, and several 35 and over. We also caught 3 32 in walleye. Plus, eddie is there with you.
In general, is Eddie anywhere near Atikokan? We are driving from the Midwest (usa) and have been to Atikokan before. Its a few hours East of Int Falls, MN.thanks
Eddie North's flies out of Nakina, about 330 miles northeast of Atikokan.There are about a dozen outfitters between International Falls and Nestor Falls.

Perhaps it sounds like a subtle difference but are you looking for a lake with a chance for a trophy or a lake known as a pike trophy lake. If it's the latter then I would suggest another day on the road to reach northern Manitoba where the opportunity for several trophies (+42") is the norm rather than the chance. If you are looking for a chance for a trophy then the previous recommendations are fine.http://www.dunlopfishing.com/index.php?page=fishing
Brett Geary's Sportsman Lodge on Little Vermilion LakeFlies out of Balmertown ON
